poker

Class PokerPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • poker.PokerPlayer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AutomatedPokerPlayer, HumanPokerPlayer

    abstract class PokerPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class that defines a basic poker player.
    Author:
    Dara Callinan, Jazheel Luna, Eoghan O'Donnell, Crischelle Pana

    • Constructor Detail

      • PokerPlayer

        PokerPlayer(java.lang.String name,
            DeckOfCards deck)
        Class constructor. Initialises the player's name and initialises their hand by dealing a new HandOfCards.
        Parameters:
        name - The String containing the player's name
        deck - The DeckOfCards being used to deal the player's hand.

    • Method Detail

      • bet

        protected int bet(int ch)
        Reduces the player's chips and increases their chipsInPot by a specified amount, simulating a standard poker bet.
        Parameters:
        ch - The amount of chips to bet.
        Returns:
        The amount of chips bet.

      • getChips

        public int getChips()
        Gets the player's current chips.
        Returns:
        The player's chips.

      • addChips

        public void addChips(int ch)
        Awards the player some chips.
        Parameters:
        ch - The amount of chips to be awarded.

      • getChipsInPot

        public int getChipsInPot()
        Gets the player's amount of chips already bet in a round of betting.
        Returns:
        The amount of chips the player has added to the pot.

      • resetChipsInPot

        public void resetChipsInPot()
        Resets the amount of chips added to the pot.

      • resetHand

      • action

        abstract int action(int betAmount,
                    int minimumBet,
                    int blind)
        Decides the player's action in a round of poker round of betting.
        Parameters:
        betAmount - The total amount necessary to call.
        minimumBet - The minimum amount that can be bet or raised.
        blind - The big blind for the game.
        Returns:
        The amount of chips added to the pot.

      • discard

        abstract int discard()
        Decides which cards the player should discard during the discard phase of a round of poker.
        Returns:
        The amount of cards discarded by the player.
